summary: This is a Notice of Appeal filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team, appealing the district court's September 2, 2020, order denying her motion to modify a protective order in her criminal case. The document establishes the procedural step of appealing to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who is appealing the denial of her motion to modify a protective order.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and submitted the Notice of Appeal on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as appearing pro hac vice on the filing.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Person who certified service of the Notice of Appeal on September 3, 2020.

connections.description: Laura A. Menninger is listed as an attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case and filed this appeal on her behalf.
Jeffrey S. Pagliuca is listed as an attorney (appearing pro hac vice) representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are attorneys from the firm HADDON, MORGAN AND FOREMAN, P.C., representing the same client in this case.

events.title: District Court Denies Motion to Modify Protective Order
events.description: The district court issued a Memorandum Opinion and Order denying Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to modify the protective order in her criminal case.

events.title: Notice of Appeal Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team filed this Notice of Appeal to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, challenging the denial of the motion to modify the protective order.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team appealed a district court order denying her motion to modify a protective order in her criminal case (20-CR-330).
The appeal was filed on September 3, 2020, and was directed to the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.
The legal basis for the immediate appeal cited the collateral order doctrine, referencing several court cases including Brown v. Maxwell from the Second Circuit.
The defense attorneys listed are Laura A. Menninger and Jeffrey S. Pagliuca (appearing pro hac vice) from the firm HADDON, MORGAN AND FOREMAN, P.C.
